title: Klein and Luna on Abolition in Brazil - evidence

content.question: Which of the following developments could best be used as evidence to support the claim in the source that “confrontational politics” led to the end of slavery in Brazil?

choices.label: The emancipation law of 1871 required formerly enslaved Brazilians to serve as apprentices for their former enslavers for twenty-one years.
In the year before Brazil declared the immediate end of slavery, some radical abolitionists distributed firearms to enslaved people.
Brazilian enslavers slowed the movement for abolition by claiming that slavery was a temporary economic necessity.
Members of the Brazilian imperial family had been convinced to support the abolition movement within the country.

content.answer: In the year before Brazil declared the immediate end of slavery, some radical abolitionists distributed firearms to enslaved people.
